Based on the code here, I think the error is thrown only if the theme is discovered >1 times on any of the following things that are collected as EndPoint:

Route
WebComponentExporter or WebComponentExporterFactory
UIInitListener
VaadinServiceInitListener
HasErrorParameter

And I don't think the theme should be on any of those classes anymore (?) even 1 time, so this code seems off now.

replies.bodyText:
For the class level javadocs something like: Defines the theme to use for the application. Should be present only once for an app, in the `AppShellConfiguration` class.

The {@code value} property defines the name of the application theme. When the theme is present inside the project, it maps to the {@code frontend/theme/}/ folder or alternatively to a folder inside the static resources of a jar file, like {@code src/main/resources/META-INF/resources//}. The application theme is always based on Lumo theme and this is the recommended way to theme applications starting from Flow 6.0 and Vaadin 19.

timeline.bodyText:
At one point at least it was discussed that this should be impossible and I think I've written it to the technical design doc - I mean basically as the application theme is always based on Lumo (that is stated in feature design doc too).
This code ^ should be not allowed as otherwise someone could try to use @Theme(value="my-theme", themeClass=Material.class) and that is not supported for now (?) Or I'm a bit confused now, could that be made to work with this from our end ? What would it mean ? And anyway, if the parent theme is not lumo, it should be done in theme.json instead since one should not be able to switch the "base theme" for an application theme with the java annotation...
Even if we could make this possible (not like this from Java code), we would then have to support this and add tests...
